title: Drawing, "Ceiling, Room of the Muses, Museo Pio-Clementino, Rome: Triumph of Apollo", ca. 1782
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash, black chalk, graphite on heavy cream paper
inscribed: Verso in graphite in a later hand: Conca/Ceiling of the Room of the Muses in the Vatican/ R.G.[?]
provenance:
Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee;
Giovanni Piancastelli
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design for a ceiling.  The octagonal design is divided into four principal panels separated by steeply foreshortened architectural columns.  Four groups of figures are depicted that deal with Apollo, the muses and the poets.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ceiling, Room of the Muses, Museo Pio-Clementino, Rome: Triumph of Apollo", ca. 1782.
ca. 1782. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash, black chalk, graphite on heavy cream paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3578.
